item.title: Report E-2023050347
item.description:
Report E-2023050347

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T12:15:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-14
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a release of UN2922 Polycat 107 from (2) 55-gallon metal drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 7' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to a pallet nail punctures in the drums. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drums were each placed into a 95-gallon poly over pack. All cleanup debris was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was on Van Line 3 IC conveyer belt when it was damaged this morning on pre load sort. Two of the four glass jugs are broken with the liquid vaporizing in the air; the other two are fine. The box was soaked in the liquid. It does not look like there was anything holding the bottom together. DescribePack: The failure was that someone put it on the conveyer belt without giving it to the driver. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: was put into plastic bags and taken to the hazmat cage

item.title: Report E-2023050169
item.description:
Report E-2023050169

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T12:15:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN1789 Chem Aqua 65605 release from a 5-gallon poly jerrican due to a nail puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to an 8' x 10' area of the trailer and dock floor due to a nail puncture. Oil dri and Kolorsafe neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023050082
item.description:
Report E-2023050082

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T12:15:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: DEER PARK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 2, 2023, at 1230 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Deer Park, Texas regarding the release of approximately 1 quart of Biotrol 12.5 (Hypochlorite solutions, UN1791, 8, III) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. The release was reportedly due to a loose cap and was contained to a 6’ x 6’ area of the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The cap on the tote was tightened and forwarded on to the consignee. All waste debris generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste drums were then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-25
  • City: LAREDO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a release of UN1490 Organic Potassium Permanganate Technical Grade from 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pint of product released to the pallet it was on due to improper loading. Absorbents pads were utilized to clean the impacted pails and pallet. The pails were re-stacked and wrapped on the pallet for shipment on. The cleanup debris was placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023050026
item.description:
Report I-2023050026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T12:15:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-07
  • City: DFW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ENVOY AIR INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Envoy Air flight 3511 from Dallas Fort Worth International Airport(DFW) to destination Gulfport-Biloxi International Airport(GPT). Passenger was at DFW on B48 Jet-Bridge with his valet bag when he noticed smoke coming out of it. Passenger located his vape pen-that was smoking. Passenger threw the vape on the Jet-Bridge and proceed to his seat on the plane. Local CFR and police responded and deemed no damage. Currently, the lithium battery is in custody of DFW Airport Fire Marshal's office.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FINDINGS IN FRA: EAWB states ELI, but within 1 overpack at least 4 packages are labeled RLI. EAWB& Booking do not mention RLI, no DGD available, packages not marked as CAO. FINDINGS IN DFW: AS PER THE AGENT, THE PLASTIC WAS RATHER THISK AND HE DID NOT SEE THE RLI STICKERS ON THE BOXES DURING THE ELI CHECK OF THE SHIPMENT. CUSTOMER: DECLARED IT AS ELI UNDER THE BOOKING AND EAWB. AFTER QUESTIONING, STATES RLI LABELS ARE OLD LABELS AND CAN BE REMOVED. FEW DAYS LATER CUSTOMER RESTATES AGAIN THIS IS REGULAR HAZMAT RLI AND PROVIDED DG DECLARATION

  • Description: On April 20, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 arrived damaged and released approximately one-half (.5) gallons of product to the trailer floor, wooden pallet, and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surfaces. E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The crew then used absorbent pads to remove any residual product.   • Description: On April 26, 2023, at 1137 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 3 gallons of IMP-IDAP-2010 (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., UN1993, 3, II) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. The release was reportedly due to a puncture to the tote and was contained to a 8’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. All waste debris generated was containerized in (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste drums were then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: On April 28, 2023, at 0000 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 1 cup of Provox C® HS II (Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate UN3378, 5.1, II) from (1) 20,000-pound supersack. The release was reportedly due to a tear during loading and was contained to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to transfer the product to a new supersack and to clean up the release using hand tools and the proper PPE. The damaged supersack was staged onsite to be returned to the shipper. All waste debris generated was containerized in (1) 5-gallon plastic drum. The waste drum was then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver stated the package was loaded on the floor of the vehicle. She attempted the delivery around 11:55 AM, but she didn't remove the package from the vehicle after confirming the recipient wasn't home. By the time she arrived at her next stop she could smell an odor coming from the package compartment. She noticed it was coming from Haz Mat package and it was leaking. DescribePack: There's no clear information on what failed and how. The driver did take pictures of the leaking package. It appears that it may have been turned on it's side or upside down prior to leaking or returned to the correct orientation. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ERTS was contacted and a Haz Mat cleanup team was dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023040954
item.description:
Report X-2023040954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T12:15:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-25
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EIGHT PACKAGES DESTINED TO HONG KONG WERE HEARD AND FELT TO BE VIBRATING AT THE UPS ORIGIN FACILITY IN TEXAS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH OF THE EIGHT BOXES CONTAINED SEVENTY-FIVE VAPORATOR SILICONE MASSAGERS. 600 TOTAL IN THE SHIPMENT. THE BATTERY CONTAINED INSIDE THE MASSAGER IS DESCRIBED ON THE MAIA WEBSITE AS A 400 MAH RECHARGEABLE LITHIUM BATTERY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE PRODUCTS CONTAINING LITHIUM BATTERIES WERE BEING SHIPPED. THE MASSAGERS WERE NOT PACKAGED IN ANY WAY TO PROTECT AGAINST SHORT CIRCUIT OR ACTIVATION DURING TRANSPORTATION TO HONG KONG. THE MASSAGERS WERE LOOSE PACKAGED IN EACH BOX. INVOICE AND THERMAL LABEL DESRIPTION IS SILICONE MASSAGERS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS ARE 1Z8283226796265526, 1Z8283226795810938, 1Z8283226797104144, 1Z8283226796669153, 1Z8283226799910573, 1Z8283226798634981, AND 1Z8283226798949963.

  • Description: On April 7, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured during unloading and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Protect Environmental Services, Inc. (PES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. PES personnel offloaded the damaged cargo, then began wiping down all undamaged cargo with absorbent pads. All undamaged cargo was repalletized for continued shipping. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all UN1263 impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On April 1, 2023, Frontier Tank Lines called ERTS to report a diesel fuel release as result of an over fuel. The Frontier Tank Lines truck was delivering fuel and didn't shut off due to a malfunction. Lonestar Hazmat was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Lonestar arrived onsite and advised a 100ft-by-100ft area of asphalt was impacted by an estimated 100 gallons of diesel fuel. No storm drains or waterways were impacted. Lonestar applied absorbent material to the impacted asphalt. There was also a thin trail of diesel that migrated under about 18 parked tractor trailers but half of them did not have drivers on site. There were a few additional puddles that were found that the contractor spread absorbents over. The crew used a pressure washer on the large area of the asphalt and the trail under the parked tractor trailers could not be cleaned properly at that time. Landstar would return once the trucks were moved. Four 55-gallon supersacks and one 330-gallon tote was generated and would be staged in New Braunfels TX, until proper disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 20, 2023, at 1414 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 1 gallon of C40 Base Zinc Primer (Paint including paint, lacquer, enamel, stain, shellac solutions, varnish, polish, liquid filler, and liquid lacquer base, MARINE POLLUTANT, UN1263, 3, II) from (1) 8-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a forklift puncture and was contained to the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged container, spent absorbents and all other waste debris generated were containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste drum was then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHW experienced a release from a 430-pound metal cylinder. ERTS dispatched contractors to inspect the cylinder and conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to a1' x1' area of the trailer floor due to an open valve. The valve was secured, and crew confirmed there was no further release of material. The released product was cleaned with clay absorbents. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023040200
item.description:
Report E-2023040200

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T12:15:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-10
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Allied International Emergency was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 25ft-by-25ft area of the concrete terminal floor and a 6ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released from a 275-gallon poly tote. Allied International Emergency personnel stated that the poly tote became damaged when it came in contact with the trailer wall and was torn. Allied International Emergency personnel neutralized the impacted areas and used granular absorbents to collect the material. Allied International Emergency personnel stated that an additional fifty (50) gallons of product was captured in containment and absorbents. The spent absorbents and debris were placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The remaining product was transferred to a new poly tote forwarded on to the consignee. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

THE PACKAGE WAS THEN BROUGHT TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING AND WAS FOUND TO BE AN AUTOMOTIVE BATTERY THAT LEAKED FROM THE CAPS. THE AUTOMOTIVE BATTERY WAS THEN PROCESSED FOLLOWING ALL DMP PROCEDURES WITHOUT INCIDENT.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN2920 1,1,3,3-Tetramethylguanidine release from a 55-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractor to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product was released to a 3’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 3’ area to the asphalt underneath the trailer. The drum was punctured by improper loading. Absorbents and neutralizers were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All material was collected and containerized into a 55 and 95-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023040519
item.description:
Report E-2023040519

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T12:15:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-03
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated he forgot to hook the hose to the drop gun before opening external valve and product flowed from the hose for about 10 seconds before he got the valve closed again. Driver utilized his whole spill kit to dam up the area to prevent it from spreading. Driver believes some product made its way into a storm drain on site. Safety asked driver to take some pictures of spill area. Driver estimated the spill traveled about 50 ft. to the drain. Safety has asked the driver to remain on site. Safety contacted EMI and they have a supervisor in route to the scene to inspect the drain. 08:27: EMI Supervisor headed to the site to inspect the drain. His ETA is approximately 2 hours. 10:26: Inspected drain, and was not impacted. QT also had their Environmental contact, Chris from APEX, onsite. Chris inspected and confirmed drain not impacted. 11:48: Lone Star generated One 5-gallon pail of cleanup material 13:06: It was determined that 34 gallons was spilled, and confirmed drain wasn’t impacted. 13:37: Texas State Report #20230732 called in by EMI.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hazmat Special Services (HMSS) to remediate the impacted surface. HMSS personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all NA1993 impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon steel overpack. Both drums of waste were placed in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DENATURED ALCOHOL IN DOOR #3 TRAILER #836716 IN THE UNLOAD WAS LEAKING AND GOT ONTO THE UNLOADER'S RIGHT HAND. I IMMEDIATELY PLACED THE HAZMAT PACKAGE IN A TOTE AND LET THE UNLOAD OPS MANAGER AND THE SORT MANAGER KNOW OF THE EXPOSURE TO THE UNLOADER'S HAND. HE IMMEDIATELY WASHED HIS HANDS AND THERE WAS NOT ANY HARM DONE TO HIM. DescribePack: THERE WERE 3 CANS OF 6 CANS OF SUNNYSIDE DENATURED ALCOHOL WITH LOOSE LIDS AND I CAN ONLY ASSUME THE PACKAGE FELL OVER IN THE TRANSIT AND THAT IS WHAT MAY HAVE CAUSED THE PACKAGE TO ACTUALLY START LEAKING FROM THE BOX. THE LIDS WERE NOT TAPED DOWN AND WERE NOT PLACED IN PLASTIC BAGS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I IMMEDIATELY PLACED THE HAZMAT PACKAGE IN A TOTE AND LET THE UNLOAD OPS MANAGER AND THE SORT MANAGER KNOW OF THE EXPOSURE TO THE UNLOADER'S HAND.   • City: SAN ANTONIO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by the Driver of Work Area 224, [PII - REMOVED BY GEM], whom noticed the package was leaking once brought back to the station after an attempt to deliver was made & no one was home to receive. Once driver noticed, he called the station in which P&D Manager Zach Dorsey had come out to the truck, examined the package & gathered the necessary safety equipment. Placed the hazmat package in a yellow drum to remove from vehicle and then applied absorbent on the leakage. Once dried they swept the truck clear of any leakage. After the cleanup, they took the damaged hazmat to the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: Package failure was due to loose caps. There was nothing inside the package to prevent excessive damage or anything to ensure the caps would not loosen. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Using absorbent to contain and easily remove the leakage & also placing the hazmat in a yellow drum to contain it.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was removed using proper PPE and placed in hazmat tote.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was dropped off of the belt at the bulk wall at 5:00AM. The package ripped during the fall and the inner drum failed near the bottom and leaked around 6 kilograms of chlorinating granules into the package. a couple of minutes afterwards the QA was notified and the spill was contained and cleaned up using latex gloves and a hazardous materials bag. DescribePack: the bottom of the drum cracked across the edge of the face. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package was not moved by employees untrained to deal with hazardous materials, and the QA was notified to ensure safe cleanup.

  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2023, at 1404 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 15 gallons of Chemlok 5150 Adhesive (Adhesives, n.o.s., UN1133, 3, II) from (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The release was reportedly due to friction during transit. No drains or waterways were reported as affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools, and the proper PPE. The damaged drums were overpacked in (2) 85-gallon metal drums. Spent absorbents and all other waste debris generated from this release were containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste drums were then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023030493
item.description:
Report E-2023030493

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T12:15:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: AMARILLO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 9, 2023, at 1510 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Amarillo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 5 gallons of Busan 1078 Biocide (Corrosive Liquid, acidic, organic, n.o.s., UN3265, 8, II) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. The release was reportedly due to a puncture to the tote from a ratchet strap. No drains or waterways were reported as affected by the release. Contractors transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote to a new one to be forwarded on to the consignee. Contractors then cleaned up the release using absorbents, hand tools, and the proper PPE. The released product, spent absorbents, and all other waste debris generated from the release were containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote, in addition to the previously mentioned poly drum were then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

When breaking down box to put in the yellow drum the smell got worse. The top of the label had gotten wet/damaged from the flammable liquid that evaporated. No one was hurt. DescribePack: Of the two glass jugs one of them had a loose cap and seal. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Bay doors and fans were on.

  • Description: On March 03, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the site. E3 personnel observed that the leaking drum had already been containerized in an 85-gallon overpack. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all UN1263-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On March 01, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of 722 NO.2 PLANET THINNER (UN1263) was damaged during a load shift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted surface. GES personnel contained the damaged pail of paint thinner in one (1) 55-gallon drum, then deployed absorbents to the released material. The crew then used hand tools to collect all paint thinner-impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR Ranger
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 6, 2023, at 1325 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Laredo Texas regarding the release of approximately 1 gallon of Sunate C White ink (Printing ink, flammable, UN1210, 3, II) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum, reportedly due to a nail puncture. No soil, drains or waterways were reportedly impacted by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. The damaged drum was overpacked in (1) 85-gallon metal drum; all other waste generated from this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste drums were then taken offsite by contractors pending proper disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN2491 Monoethanolamine Iron and Chloride Free release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: IT was reported by the train crew that the residue car was releasing from the reclosing pressure relief valve. The car was inspected, the pressure was at 70 psi and not releasing from the reclosing pressure relief. It was determined that there could be a small amount of product still in the car and there could be a loss of vacuum in the refrigerated car which could contribute the pressure increase of the car. The pressure was reduced to 15 psi and the car was released to destination under an OTMA 3.

item.title: Report E-2023030058
item.description:
Report E-2023030058

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-24
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LHO notified ERTS of a release impacting their trailer floor and asphalt lot below. ERTS dispatched contractors to investigate the release and provide cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of UN1263 Imron Activator released from a 55-gallon metal drum to a 53' x 8' area of the trailer floor and 40' x 1' area of the concrete lot below the trailer due to a dent in the bottom of the drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damage drum was placed into a 95-gallon metal overpack. All spent absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

X-2023020936 SequenceEvent: Box was found in the unload by door 19. Upon inspection of the box and contents, the box was wet on the bottom because of the liquid was leaking from the bottom of the plastic bottle. There was nothing protecting the plastic bottle from being damaged. The sink & surface cleaner sanitizer was dented and punctured on the sides. The cap and the seal seemed and looked good there was nothing that I saw was wrong with it. DescribePack: there was nothing protecting the plastic bottle from being dented nor punctured DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: bay doors open and fans on.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-14
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 14, 2023, at 0900ET, XPO Logistics terminal LDA reported UN1760 "Sunbrite 44" released 5-gallons on the concrete dock floor due to a puncture by a forklift accident. ERTS dispatched Lone Star Hazmat Response to perform all onsite clean up actives. On February 14, 2023, at 1015 ET, Lone Star arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 65-gallon overpack drum. Absorbents were utilized and worked into the impacted surfaces. Sodium bicarb was placed to neutralize the release. The absorbent waste and neutralizer were then containerized into a 55-gallon play drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: 1. X-2023020622 SequenceEvent: The package entered the facility from the unload area. On the way to its work area, it fell off of a conveyer belt and began to leak at 6.00 AM. After an hour the spill was found and mitigated using latex gloves and absorbent pads to place the package in a hazardous materials bag. DescribePack: The caps of the jugs contained in the package became loosened and leaked their inner fluid near the top of the package and the top of the jugs. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: absorbent pads and latex gloves were used to contain the package in a hazardous materials bag. 2. X-2023020623 SequenceEvent: Package entered the facility from the unload area. Upon traveling from the unload area to its work area it fell off of the belt and spilled at 6.00AM. When the package was discovered by QA, latex gloves and absorbent pads were used to mitigate the spill and pplace the container in a hazardous materials bag. DescribePack: the caps of the concentrated dish washer liquid jugs in the container were loosened due to the package impacting the ground. The liquid leaked towards the side of the package and soaked into the container outside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: latex gloves and absorbent pads were used to place the container into a hazardous materials bag, and to clean the spill.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During loading fluid was identified to be leaking from the crate. The shipper removed the crate from the FCC truck and placed it on an asphalt driveway for inspection. The high voltage technician at the shipper inspected the freight and discovered a cracked cap on the battery component. The faulty cap was replaced and the release was cleaned by the shipper. The shipper estimated that there was approximately 1/4 cup of coolant fluid released from the freight total in the truck and on their parking lot. Randall Johnson, director of manufacturing, oversaw the clean up and cap replacement. The identification of the release and clean up took less than 1 hour total.

  • Description: On February 8, 2023, ERTS was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 10 ounces of IMP-SAS-2011 (Flammable liquid, n.o.s., Methanol, UN1993, 3, III) from (1) 275-gallon plastic tote, reportedly due to a leaking valve. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. Contractors then transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote to a new tote to be forwarded on to the consignee. No waste was generated from this event.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LHO experienced a release of UN1263 Ceranamel XT40S from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in an 8' x 16' area as well as to the concrete lot below in a 25' trail due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Oil Dri was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On February 7, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of phosphoric and sulfuric acid (UN3264) was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon drum, then deployed granular absorbents to the released material. All phosphoric and sulfuric acid-impacted material was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal via RLC's waste stream.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver from WA 239 removed this package due to a leak. I grabbed the wet box and placed it into a black spill bin. Moved it to my processing station and opened for inspection, i saw two, one gallon jugs of wood stain chemical. Each gallon jug had 3 haz mat diamonds on it, including a corrosive diamond. i then retrieved a yellow haz mat bucked with blue lining, PPE- gloves, mask and eye protection, i did the ISF and DPR then placed both of the hazmats in a bin with the used PPE and towels used to clean up the spill from tote. DescribePack: Both of the caps on both gallon jugs are loose and content laked out. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: the cap was not spill proof and the package was on the wrong side. I placed the package in a black spill bin, once the hazmat was identified i places in into a lined haz mat bucket.

  • City: LA PORTE

  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 2 Super Sacks containing Chromium waste from Eagle Window and Door were accepted into our transportation network. These bags had been previously stored in an unprotected area where they were exposed to the elements, ie., snow or rain. These water permeated the mesh bags and wetted the material inside. When the water leached out while in-transit, it became contaminated by the Chromium material contained within the Super Sack. The result was approximately 2 quarts of the solid Chromium material being released as an aqueous solution due to the permeation of the water.

  • Carrier/Reporter: KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 00:30 on 1/6/2022, Kansas City Southern Railway's(KCS) Environmental& Hazmat Department was notified of an Ammonia odor in the KCS Port Arthur, TX rail yard. A railroad qualified response contractor was mobilized to investigate the odor. Upon arrival, responders identified SHPX 221270 as the Ieaking tank car. Responders dawned proper PPE before ascending the car. Once on top of SHPX 221270, responders found the A-slde liquid valve less than tool tight and the A-side liquid valve plug was also less than tool tight. Estimated release was 3 gallons. The liquid valve and the plug were both secured tool tight. Once secure, the rail car was released back Into transportation. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the tlme offiling. This shipment was offered as a'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package Is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a release on UN1090 Axalta T-1021-01 from boxes containing four 1-gallon metal cans. The cans were crushed due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-quarts of product released to a 6' x 6' area of the concrete dock floor due to being crushed. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. A total of 6 damaged cans, impacted cardboard, and cleanup debris were then collected into four 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2023010502

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-13
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LFW experienced a UN3266 "ZEP X-203" release from a 275-gallon poly tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 80-gallons of product released to a 7' by 20' area inside the trailer and a 7' by 53' area outside the trailer on the concrete lot due to a puncture. The product was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into nine 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-16
  • City: ROUND ROCK

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING SIX-SIDED CHECK WE NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED FOR CONTENT INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION WE DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING ICE CREAM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. OUTER BOX IS A THERMO CHILL INSULATED SHIPPER BOX PREPRINTED AS PERISHABLE, RUSH, AND UP ARROWS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT 010EX6, AMY'S ICE CREAMS, 1101 W ANDERSON LN, AUSTIN TX 78757.

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-04

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Veolia forklift driver was removing a pallet from the truck at Veolia's ten day transfer facility when a drum containing paint related material slid off of the pallet, causing the top to break and spilled about 20 gallons. Work was immediately stopped and supervisors were called. From there floor dry was put on the ground to contain any liquid leaking from the truck, vermiculite was put in the trailer to soak up the liquid, once the liquid absorbed the floor dry and vermiculite were put into an overpack along with the 30 gallon container.

item.title: Report E-2023010237
item.description:
Report E-2023010237

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-06
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1206 PM ET, XPO Logistics terminal LHO reported a spill that was discovered inside of a trailer located in Houston, TX. The spill consisted of an unknown number of damaged plastic bags of Niterox sodium nitrate, which were found inside of a trailer in a damaged condition and spilled out onto the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-pounds of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to load shift ripping the bags. A total of 8 damaged bags and released product were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On January 12, 2023, at 2212 ET, ERTS was contacted by Landstar personnel in Quanah, Texas regarding the release of approximately 5 gallons of Phosphoric Acid (Phosphoric acid, solution, UN1805). The release was reportedly due to an emergency hard break in transport and was contained to the trailer and asphalt beneath the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to manage all onsite cleanup activities. The release was cleaned up using a neutralizing agent, absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. The damaged drum was overpacked and forwarded on to the consignee. The neutralizer, spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (1) 55-gallon plastic drum for proper disposal.

  • Description: At 0646 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LGT. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of UN1263 Velocity Automotive Products Fast Thinner 2005G was released from a 5-gallon metal drum due to the drum being over-strapped during transit. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3113004. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The damaged pail and all spent absorbents were placed into a 10-gallon metal drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2023010084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-04
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1015 ET, XPO Logistics (LTX) contacted ERTS to report a regulated cargo release. It was reported plastic jugs containing UN2031 Suma Cal-X Descaler were discovered leaking, releasing product to the dock floor. ERTS reviewed and determined terminal personnel were not capable of conducting clean-up and a contractor was dispatched to conduct all cleanup and containment activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to the dock floor in a 3' x 1' area from two damaged jugs due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area. The damaged box, empty jugs, and impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. A total of 12 non-damaged but impacted jugs were collected and containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank car was reported leaking by UPRR train crew employees. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. The car had two loose blind flange bolts on the air inlet/vapor valve and the valve was in the closed position when found. The responders tightened the loose flange bolts, and the leak was stopped. We had them open and close the valve to cycle it if it had anything obstructing it from closing all the way. Haz Mat Manager spoke with the shipper and car owner, and they will arrange for a mobile repair crew to test the valve or get an FRA movement approval for it to be delivered to the plant.

  • Description: 1. X-2023010099 RESPONDER CALLED TO WET PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE TO FIND TPACKAGE WAS WET FROM THE CONTENTS INSIDE. THERE WAS NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR. THE BOX HAD A CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL ON THE SIDE. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOXES IN A SPILL TRAY AND BROUGHT THEM BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR PROCESSING. 2. X-2023010100 RESPONDER NOTIFIED OF A LEAKING PACKAGE IN UNLOAD. RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE TO DISCOVER THAT A BOX, WITH A CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL, WET FROM THE CONTENTS WITHIN THE BOX. THERE WAS NO LIQUID ON THE GROUND. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A DMP SPILL TRAY AND TOOK IT TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED. 3. X-2023010101 RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE TO DISCOVER A BOX THAT WAS WET FROM THE INSIDE TO THE OUTSIDE. CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL ON PACKAGE. THERE WAS NO MATERIAL THAT HAD SPILLED ONTO THE FLOOR, CONTAINED WITHIN PACKAGE. RESPONDER PLACED IT IN A DMP SPIL TRAY AND TOOK IT TO THE CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.

  • Description: On December 23, 2022, Resolute Environmental & Response Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer floor and estimated that twenty (20) gallon of material was released. Resolute Environmental & Response Services stated that five (5) totes were damaged when the driver had a hard stop. Seven (7) totes were transported to the contractor’s shop to transfer the material into new un-damaged totes. The trailer floor was neutralized, and the absorbents were collected and placed into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The new totes were loaded into a Landstar truck to be delivered to the shipper. The empty totes were left at the contractor’s shop to be processed for disposal. The generated waste containers were transported offsite by Resolute Environmental & Response Services personnel to process for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022120747
item.description:
Report E-2022120747

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-11
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/11/22 Schneider National contacted ERTS on behalf of Schneider Bulk to report that one of their tankers was at a Quala Wash and sunk into the pavement causing it to tip over and lean onto the tank next to it. The tanker was holding UN2789 Acetic Acid and it was unknown where the leak was coming from, but it was likely from the dome lid or crash box. On 12/11/22, at 2030 ET, Cleaning Guys (CG) arrived on site and assessed the impact areas. The tanker was rolled on its side but at the time, it didn’t look like there was an active leak. CG estimated 3500 gallons of product spilled on the lot in a 12ft by 20ft yard area. There were several potholes in the lot where product as well as rainwater was pooling. Since the tanker was surrounded by released product, CG could not access the tanker. CG had their skid steer en route along with the rest of the crew to scrape up the impacted parking lot, which is a soil gravel mix instead of concrete, and pile it to the side on poly sheets until they can get roll-off boxes on site. CG was bringing a Betz Valve to assist in transferring the tanker’s remaining contents into another tanker. A vacuum truck was also required and is en route. The vacuum truck will be used to remove the collected product and water from the parking lot. Then the soil will be scraped. The liquid-collected waste will be placed into a frac tank on site until disposal can be coordinated. The Schneider dispatched wrecking company could not perform the uprighting of the trailer. CG dispatched Beards Towing. CG pH tested the standing water, and it came out to a 4 so the material is safe for their frac tank. At 0000 ET, the vacuum truck arrived, and the pumping began. At 0205 ET, the wreckers were on site. The tanker was uprighted at 0242 ET. The crew began to transfer the remaining product from the damaged tanker. At 0500 ET, CG completed the transfer. CG placed a berm around the damaged trailer to prevent any leaking. CG placed the impacted gravel piled on a poly sheet and will order roll-off boxes to containerize. The relief tanker departed the site. At this point, it is estimated that approximately 8000 gallons of impacted water and 30 yards of impacted soil will be disposed of. The site was secured for the crew to return for the remaining work. On 12/12/22 at 1235 ET, CG returned to the site to pH spot sample the puddles to determine if any water needs to be pumped and take a water sample from the creek/pond to determine if there is any impact there. All readings were neutral. The pond is approximately 1500ft from the spill site. ERTS reached out to Schneider and determined the original amount in the tanker was 5389 gallons. At 1302 ET, TCEQ Will Daughtrey, called and was updated on the progress. He also stated the TCEQ will only require confirmation pH sampling taken to a lab to show the areas in question being below the background areas. Mr. Daughtrey visited the site and assessed the site in person. There

item.description:
Report X-2022120831

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-08
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was in the unload door 16, put in a black tote. Box was inspected found that the outside and some of the inside along with the egg carton was wet because of the loose cap. The area which the box was found at had no residue because the liquid had merged with the air and had evaporated leaving nothing behind. There was no liquid found in the black tote. No one was hurt. DescribePack: there were no hole or cracks. the box was taped up, but the egg carton that held one of the glass jugs had a lose cap/seal on it. I found this out when I touched the cap/seal of it along with when lifting it up out of the box it was very light because half of the liquid had evaporated out of the jug. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: the fans and the bay doors were open so that no one could inhale it and people were told to stay away from the area.

item.description:
Report E-2022120695

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-19
  • City: COMFORT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PETROLEUM TRANSPORTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was travelling in incliment, rainy, weather when he lost control of tractor trailer. The driver tried to correct the skid but lost all controll. The truck stayed upright but the trailer rolled onto its passenger side and skidded on the highway for roughly 100 yds. This skid caused all compartments on the trailer to rupture due to friction with the roadway. The ruptures allowed roughly 7800 of the the total 8000 gallons to spill onto the roadway and into the ditch on the side of the roadway. 9-11 was promptly called and services arrived at the scene within minutes. EMT's checked the driver. TX State Trooper performed the accident investigation. TX Dot put out cones for lane closures and dumped sand into the ditch to keep materiels from running.

item.title: Report E-2022120640
item.description:
Report E-2022120640

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-19
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 19, 2022, Landstar Ranger reported a release of UN1263. E3 Environmental (E3) was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that forty-eight (48) gallons of material was released when a nail punctured the 55-gallon drum. E3 personnel solidify the remaining material inside the 55-gallon metal drum and used a drum vacuum to collect the released material to solidify and place into three (3) additional metal drums. E3 personnel generated one (1) super sack containing three (3) impacted pallets and absorbent pads as well as overpacked the damaged drum into one 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste containers were transported offsite by E3 personnel to process for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022120486
item.description:
Report E-2022120486

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-13
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0633 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LLA. It was reported that approximately 5-gallons of Nacure 155 was released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 5' x 8' and the asphalt lot in a 2' x 2' area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and then collected along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022120478
item.description:
Report E-2022120478

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-09
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 07:47 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (LHO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to the tote being punctured by an unknown object at the top, approximately 3 teaspoons of Reaxis S50 (Hazardous - UN3264) was released. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-ounces of product released to the dock floor in a 2" x 2" area due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote and all cleanup debris were containerized into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022120477
item.description:
Report E-2022120477

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-12
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 12, 2022 at 0802 ET, XPO Logistics (LHW terminal) contacted ERTS regarding a UN3266, Corrosive liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., 8, PG II "Concentrated Industrial Purple Degreaser" release that occurred at 0800 ET. It was advised that 1 cup of of product released from at least (1) 2.5-gallon plastic jug on the dock due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors for containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released to the dock floor in a 2' x 2' area due to a pallet puncture. The damaged jug, impacted absorbents, and impacted box were collected and containerized into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE BOX WAS PLACED INTO A LINED 5 GALLON SALVAGE PAIL AND SEALED.

BOX SATURATED WITH SUBSTANCE AND CANS SOILED AND STAINED. ONE OTHER CAN CRUSHED AT THE BOTTOM IN A CORNER. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: THE BOTTOM OF THE CAN WAS PLUGGED AND COVERED WITH ABSORB. THE ABSORB PADS WERE LAYERED AND TAPED DOWN. THE CAN WAS PLACED BOTTOM UP IN A BAG OF DUCK ABSORB. THIS BAG WAS SEALED IN A SIPPERED BAG AND PLACED BOTTOM UP IN THE LINED SALVAGE DRUM, BRACED BY 4 OF THE OTHER 5 CANS AND COVERED WITH ABSORB PADS AND CARDBOARD. THE BAG WAS THEM ZIP TIED CLOSED.

item.title: Report E-2022120300
item.description:
Report E-2022120300

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-16
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal LDA called in to report a 3-gallon spill of UN3098 due to the 55-gallon plastic drum it was in being cut by a metal part of the trailer that was sticking out. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 3' x 2' area of the trailer floor due a puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Sodium bicarb solution and absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110676
item.description:
Report E-2022110676

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-22
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.At 1512 ET, XPO Logistics notified ERTS of a UN3082 release from a 55 gallon metal drum. XPO requested contractor assistance. ERTS dispatch GrayMar for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to the trailer floor in a 2' x 3’ area area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was collected into a 65-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage. 2. E-2022120436 During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of synersol (un3082) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

X-2022110832 SequenceEvent: Box was found wet at the end of the conveyor belt on load side. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of two jugs appeared to have leaked from cap but was still mostly full. No further leakage was observed after cap was tightened. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a plastic bag. Leakage was not spreading. Box was placed in salvage drum during inspection. 3. X-2022110836 SequenceEvent: Package was found wet at the end of conveyor belt on load side. DescribePack: Upon inspection, both caps were loose but jugs were still mostly full. Some leakage was present in the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a plastic bag and placed in salvage drum during inspection. 4. X-2022110837 SequenceEvent: Package was found wet on loadside and brought to Hazmat area for inspection. DescribePack: One side of the box was wet. X-2022110841 SequenceEvent: Box was found wet and torn and moved to Hazmat area for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one jug had a loose cap and was less full than the other. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in thick bag and tote. 7. X-2022110842 SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and moved to Hazmat area for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, neither cap appeared loose but one jug appeared slightly less full than the other. Box was wet and torn. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in thick bag inside of tote.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-17
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO terminal LDA requested services related to a release of of Muriatic Acid (UN1789) from 4, 1-gallon plastic containers due to a forklift puncture on the dock. ERTS dispatched a contractor for cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1.5-gallons of product released to a 10' x 10' area of the concrete dock floor from two of the jugs. All damaged bottles and packaging were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The area was then neutralized with soda ash and absorbents, these were collected into a second 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022110273
item.description:
Report X-2022110273

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-05
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS INFORMED OF A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER DONNED PPE: BOOTS GLOVES GOGGLES AND APRON AND TOOK FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART TO THE SCENE AND SET UP A 15 FOOT HOT ZONE USING WORD OF MOUTH. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND APROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET TO PROPERLY CLEAN AND CONTAINERIZED THE PILL FOR TRANSPORTATION AND PROCESSING IN THE DMP.

  • Description: At 0948 ET, XPO logistics terminal LGT called to report a 1 gallon release of MIL-DTL-53022F Type 4 Class L. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assess and clean the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of Mil-DTL-53022f released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture and impacted two other cans of the same material and seven 5-gallon pails of Zinc Rich Epoxy Primer as well as three 1-gallon cans of Zinc Rich Epoxy Primer. The affected freight was separated and placed into waste drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: While offloading a load of drums and boxes at Veolia's ten day intransit facility, a small puddle of liquid was found on the warehouse floor. When the suspected drum was moved off the pallet, a pinhole leak was discovered and a wet spot was observed on the pallet. Further investigation revealed there was also a white spot in the trailer where the drum had been. The drum was immediately overpacked and the spill was cleaned up using rags. It is unknown how the drum was punctured.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal LHO contacted ERTS to report a spill from one 2,270-pound super sack containing regulated UN2967 "Sulfamic Acid" that was released impacting the concrete dock floor. ERTS dispatched Allied International to conduct cleanup. At 1400 ET, AIE personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-ounce of product released to the concrete dock floor due to a puncture. The material was transferred into a new gaylord. The material released was collected along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022101295
item.description:
Report X-2022101295

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-07
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Spill Agent was called to a spill at our Hub facility in Dallas-Fort Worth. Package was showing what appeared to be yellow paint seeping from a corner of the box. Further inspection found a fibreboard box wrapped in multiple layers of purple shrink wrap obscuring the sides of the inner box. When the shrink wrap was removed it was seen the box was marked with a Ground Limited Quantity label on 2 sides of the box. The box contained 4 metal can marked as UN 1263. there was no positive closure noted on the cans. SDS was found with the shipment and confirmed the contents. contents were placed in a steel salvage drum and held pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report I-2022120091
item.description:
Report I-2022120091

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-26
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CTCX 207824 located on Track 1 at North Yard appeared to have grease around the bottom outlet valve, Slick Response was contacted and asked to respond to the location to clean and make any needed repairs to the car. Upon arriving on location, Slick personnel locked out the track after receiving authorization to foul the track and began cleaning the outlet valve. Upon cleaning the car, Slick personnel began looking around the valve and found that the flange bolts were all excessively loose and taking at least three to four complete turns to tighten down the bolts for securement. Once the bolts were tightened, Slick personnel completed cleaning the valve then released the car back to PTRA along with the track.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As Flight Attendant 4 and I were working the beverage cart serving beverages and snacks to the Main Cabin passengers, we were at Row 16 when I witnessed an explosion in Row 20. I heard a loud noise from the explosion and saw sparks flying, both black and white smoke quickly appeared and filled the entire cabin. I was on the forward part of the cart and ran up to the Forward Galley to inform Flight Attendant 1, that we had a safety alert and that there was an explosion of a battery of some sort and that the cabin was filling with smoke. I then ran back to the cart and took out the Fire Containment bag from the overhead bin above row 16. I handed Flight Attendant 4 the fire containment bag while the FA2, brought an insert to put the"Baby Bottle Warmer" in that exploded into the fire containment bag and to the AFT galley where FA4 cleared out a catering cart to put the fire containment bag in. The passenger, Mikaila Norwood, and her infant, had black charred on their faces, so we gave her water and napkins to wipe her face with and the baby's face. We notified the pilots what happened, and they were told to continue to DFW if the situation was under control. Mikaila Norwood, refused any medical attention, even though the nurse on board suggested we get an oxygen tank for the infant child to use. We turned the power ports off for the rest of the flight.· The customer had plugged the baby bottle warmer into the USB powerport between the seats before the incident occurred.

I PUT THE PACKAGE IN A LEAK PROOF CONTAINER AND PUT IN HAZMAT CAGE UNTIL WAS ABLE TO PROCESS ACCORDINGLY. DescribePack: LEAKAGE WAS NOTICED AROUND THE RIM OF THE LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT THE PACKAGE IN A PLASTIC BAG AND THEN INTO A LEAK PROOF PLASTIC TOTE.

  • Description: 1. X-2022110301 SequenceEvent: Hazmat was being transported via Tugger train; drum was too close to the edge on a turn and fell off the side. Drum was placed upright, spill was neutralized. Drum moved to Hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: lid failed to operate after impact. no other damage detected. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: drum was placed upright. This stopped contents from continuing to leak out. 2. X-2022110302 SequenceEvent: Drum was placed on tugger train, tugger train turned causing the drum to fall off allowing damage and a small spill. Spill was neutralized, hazmat moved to Hazmat Cage for further processing. DescribePack: lid dented on one side allowing leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: drum placed upright.

  • City: HOUSTON

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1310 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LHW. It was reported that approximately 3 ounces of HandiFoam Slow Rise Component B released from a 1400-lb cylinder due to a malfunction in a patch on the cylinder. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to conduct cleanup. At 1530 ET, contractors arrived onsite and advised the cylinder had a crack near the bottom of the container resulting in a 3-ounce release of product to the dock floor in a 5" x 5' area. The crack was sealed with putty to prevent further release. All waste was containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste and cylinder were staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-13
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approximately 10 gallons of IMP-RHS-11 released impacting the trailer floor and concrete below the trailer at the referenced location from a leaking gasket that was not sealed properly. E3 Environmental was dispatched to the site to complete cleanup activities. Upon the contractor's arrival, personnel observed the majority of the trailer floor impacted as well as a 4' by 5' area of the concrete below the trailer. All other totes were removed, inspected and decontaminated to be shipped on. The product remaining in the compromised tote was transferred into a new tote. E3 Environmental personnel utilized absorbent pads to absorb the liquids present on the trailer floor and concrete. All spent absorbents were placed into one 55-gallon poly drum with the compromised tote that was cut up. All waste generated was left onsite as directed by Landstar.

  • Description: XPO terminal LHW reports a release of 3 pounds of "Phycomycin" (UN3378) after a 50-pound plastic bag was punctured due to improper loading inside of the trailer. ERTS dispatched Milstead HMR to conduct cleanup. At 0740 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to other freight tearing the bag open. The damaged bag, released product, and cleanup debris were collected into a 55 gallon poly drum. The remaining bags were re-wrapped and secured for shipment onto the consignee. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR EXPRESS AMERICA, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 5, 2022, ERTS received a request to dispatch a remediation contractor to assist with a tote transfer for cargo on Trailer 691599. Following contractor arrival and initial visual assessment, it was determined that a single tote containing Orfom® CO1601 had spilled approximately three (3) gallons of product from a crack/slice located near the top corner of the tote. Based on visual observation, the contractor stated that this crack/slice may have been caused by a forklift blade, but this could not be confirmed. Media affected was limited to trailer flooring components, which were properly addressed using pads and simple green. E3 departed the site with one supersack containing the original empty tote and 1–55-gallon poly drum containing impacted spill pads and PPE until disposed of on October 19, 2022 at Tirabella Environmental in Edinburg Texas.

  • Description: On October 18, 2022, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3082 was damaged and released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency Services (E3) to perform the necessary corrective actions. E3 personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized the damaged tote and all UN3082-impacted material into one (1) super sack for disposal. The remaining virgin product was gravity transferred to a new 330-gallon tote and shipped.

  • Description: XPO Terminal LDA called in to report a .5-pound spill of UN1499 Draw Temp 430 from a 417-pound fiberboard drum caused by a forklift puncture and impacting their dock floor. ERTS dispatched Lone Star Hazmat Response (LSHR) to conduct cleanup. At 0734 ET, LSHR personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.25 cup of product released onto the dock floor in a 5' x 5' area due to a forklift puncture. The contractor cleaned and contained the release and placed the waste into a 95 gallon poly drum and a 5 gallon poly drum. All generated waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS UNKNOWN TO HAZMAT SPECIALIST. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE. PACKAGE ONLY HAD 2 JERRICANS INSIDE, BUT ACCORDING TO THE WEIGHT ON THE OP-900, THERE WERE POSSIBLY A TOTAL OF 4 JERRICANS. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF CONTENTS INSIDE, ONLY ONE OF THE JERRICANS WERE DAMAGED. THE SEAL UNDER THE CAP, WHICH WAS LOOSENED, WAS TORN HALF WAY OFF AND LIQUID CONTENT LEAKED OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOTH JERRICANS WERE INSPECTED AND THE LEAKING JERRICAN'S CAP WAS TIGHTENED. LEAK PROOF SEAL IS STILL TORN.

item.title: Report X-2022100986
item.description:
Report X-2022100986

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-07
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: On October 7, 2022 at 1630 hours, I was informed by my supervisor to process a damaged hazmat package that the previous shift had placed in the East HazMat cage. I found the damaged Hazmat inside a blue plastic bag that was inside an orange plastic container. Upon opening the plastic bag, I found a white package that had wet spots. No other damage was observed on package. Pictures were taken of package and of all its contents. Package contained four, 1-gallon plastic containers each filled with Master Care Triple D Medium Duty Universal Coil Cleaner. One of the containers had a loose cap and an open seal. This allowed about 5 ounces of its contents to spill inside package. Upon inspection of package, I found that the Tracking # on label (6093 3554 7638) did not match the Tracking # on the OP-900 (6093 3554 7660). However, the hazmat description and quantity on the OP-900 did match the information listed on the package. I also discovered that the hazmat package did not have the required, 4 inch per side, colored, Corrosive hazard label. This package did not have the Hazmat certificate since it was processed on 10-05-22, at 310 BRSL. DescribePack: The outer package did not have any visible damage except for some wet spots caused by the spilled hazmat. The failure was the result of one container having a loose cap and an open seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged hazmat package was immediately placed in a blue plastic bag and the bag opening was tied closed. The plastic bag was then placed in an orange plastic container. The orange container was then placed in the secure East HazMat cage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 6, 2022, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Duraspar Prime High Speed Curing Agent (UN3470) was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the inner packaging of the cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Allied/Ambipar (AES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. AES personnel packed the damaged pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum, then deployed absorbents. The crew utilized hand tools and wipes to remediate the impacted surface and containerized all paint-impacted material in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022100448
item.description:
Report E-2022100448

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-16T18:11:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 13, 2022, at 1259 ET, XPO Logistics (LDA) contacted ERTS to report a regulated cargo release. It was reported a 55 gallon plastic drum was discovered leaking in a trailer, releasing a total of 3 gallons of the product to the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched Lone Star Hazmat Response (LSHR) to conduct cleanup. At 1400 ET, LSHR personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 gallons of UN1908 "Keeper Professional Red Meat" released from a 55 gallon poly drum. The release impacted a 5' x 7' area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 3' area of the concrete lot below the trailer. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged drum was collected into a 95 gallon poly drum and cleanup debris was placed into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On Oct 7th, at approximately 1600 the AFW station contacted DG admin about a package spill. Inside the package was several food products, including 2 aerosol cans of cooking spray. The cap was dislodged from one of the cooking sprays allowing the contents to leak out and soak into the package. There were no markings or labels on the outside of the package suggesting that there were any DG included in the shipment. The package was improperly prepared for transportation. The package has been held pending disposition.

  • Description: At 12:07 PM the PTRA recieved a report that the VMSX 5338 in track 58 at North Yard was leaking, there was small amount of product that had leaked down the side of the car but had not made contact with the ground. Slick Response responded and found that there was no gasket on the lid or around the neck, shipper tightened manway bolts as tightly as they could but due to the fact no gasket was applied this did not prevent product from leaking. Slick Response applied gasket to lid/neck closed and tightened lid and cleaned car before releasing for movement.

OMI Environmental Solutions (OMI) was dispatched to perform the cleanup. OMI off loaded the trailer until they found the leaking drum. The leaking drum was placed into an overpack drum.
